publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1917 Robert Brown: 100 Years of Irn Bru—That the Parliament welcomes the centenary of Scotland’s "other" national drink, Irn Bru, first produced in Glasgow by Andrew Greig Barr; acknowledges the continued success of AG Barr plc as an independent Scottish company; notes that Scotland is unique as the only nation to produce a local soft drink which outsells a certain well-known brand of cola; recognises the example that the company sets to other Scottish companies in terms of local production, and wishes AG Barr plc every success for another prosperous 100 years.
S1M-1917 100 Years of Irn Bru (lodged on 8 May 2001) Mr Brian Monteith*

S1M-1917 Robert Brown: 100 Years of Irn Bru—That the Parliament welcomes the centenary of Scotland’s "other" national drink, Irn Bru, first produced in Glasgow by Andrew Greig Barr; acknowledges the continued success of AG Barr plc as an independent Scottish company; notes that Scotland is unique as the only nation to produce a local soft drink which outsells a certain well-known brand of cola; recognises the example that the company sets to other Scottish companies in terms of local production, and wishes AG Barr plc every success for another prosperous 100 years. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith
S1M-1917 100 Years of Irn Bru (lodged on 8 May 2001) Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Tricia Marwick*
S1M-1917 100 Years of Irn Bru (lodged on 8 May 2001) Linda Fabiani*, Andrew Wilson*, Donald Gorrie*, Mr Jamie Stone*
S1M-1917 100 Years of Irn Bru (lodged on 8 May 2001) Christine Grahame*, Scott Barrie*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*
S1M-1917 100 Years of Irn Bru (lodged on 8 May 2001) Nora Radcliffe*

S1M-1917 Robert Brown: 100 Years of Irn Bru—That the Parliament welcomes the centenary of Scotland’s "other" national drink, Irn Bru, first produced in Glasgow by Andrew Greig Barr; acknowledges the continued success of AG Barr plc as an independent Scottish company; notes that Scotland is unique as the only nation to produce a local soft drink which outsells a certain well-known brand of cola; recognises the example that the company sets to other Scottish companies in terms of local production, and wishes AG Barr plc every success for another prosperous 100 years. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Tricia Marwick, Linda Fabiani, Andrew Wilson, Donald Gorrie, Mr Jamie Stone, Christine Grahame, Scott Barrie, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Duncan Hamilton*, Mr Andrew Welsh*
S1M-1917 100 Years of Irn Bru (lodged on 8 May 2001) Fiona McLeod*
S1M-1917 100 Years of Irn Bru (lodged on 8 May 2001) Alex Neil*

S1M-1917 Robert Brown: 100 Years of Irn Bru—That the Parliament welcomes the centenary of Scotland’s "other" national drink, Irn Bru, first produced in Glasgow by Andrew Greig Barr; acknowledges the continued success of AG Barr plc as an independent Scottish company; notes that Scotland is unique as the only nation to produce a local soft drink which outsells a certain well-known brand of cola; recognises the example that the company sets to other Scottish companies in terms of local production, and wishes AG Barr plc every success for another prosperous 100 years. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Tricia Marwick, Linda Fabiani, Andrew Wilson, Donald Gorrie, Mr Jamie Stone, Christine Grahame, Scott Barrie, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Andrew Welsh, Fiona McLeod, Alex Neil
S1M-1917 100 Years of Irn Bru (lodged on 8 May 2001) Michael Russell*

Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Tricia Marwick, Linda Fabiani, Andrew Wilson, Donald Gorrie, Mr Jamie Stone, Christine Grahame, Scott Barrie, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Andrew Welsh, Fiona McLeod, Alex Neil, Michael Russell, David Mundell*

S1M-1917 Robert Brown: 100 Years of Irn Bru—That the Parliament welcomes the centenary of Scotland’s "other" national drink, Irn Bru, first produced in Glasgow by Andrew Greig Barr; acknowledges the continued success of AG Barr plc as an independent Scottish company; notes that Scotland is unique as the only nation to produce a local soft drink which outsells a certain well-known brand of cola; recognises the example that the company sets to other Scottish companies in terms of local production, and wishes AG Barr plc every success for another prosperous 100 years. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Tricia Marwick, Linda Fabiani, Andrew Wilson, Donald Gorrie, Mr Jamie Stone, Christine Grahame, Scott Barrie, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Andrew Welsh, Fiona McLeod, Alex Neil, Michael Russell, David Mundell, Pauline McNeill

S1M-1917 Robert Brown: 100 Years of Irn Bru—That the Parliament welcomes the centenary of Scotland’s "other" national drink, Irn Bru, first produced in Glasgow by Andrew Greig Barr; acknowledges the continued success of AG Barr plc as an independent Scottish company; notes that Scotland is unique as the only nation to produce a local soft drink which outsells a certain well-known brand of cola; recognises the example that the company sets to other Scottish companies in terms of local production, and wishes AG Barr plc every success for another prosperous 100 years.
